sen.j: 蘇我満智（そがの まち、男性）は、古墳時代の豪族。
sen.e: SOGA no Machi (male) came from a local ruling family in the Kofun period.
SOGA no Machi (male) was a member of a local ruling family in the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: 原訳では本人が古墳時代に生きたことがはっきりしません。came from→was a member of としました。
sen.e: SOGA no Machi (male) was a member of a local ruling family in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 蘇我石川宿禰の子で、武内宿禰の孫にあたる。
sen.e: He was the son of SOGA no Ishikawa no Sukune and grandchild of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.
He was the son of SOGA no Ishikawa no Sukune and grandchild of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.
He was the son of SOGA no Ishikawa no Sukune and grandchild of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.

sen.j: 蘇我韓子の父、蘇我稲目の曾祖父。
sen.e: He was the father of SOGA no Karako and great-grandfather of SOGA no Iname.
He was the father of SOGA no Karako and great-grandfather of SOGA no Iname.
He was the father of SOGA no Karako and great-grandfather of SOGA no Iname.
It is said that his name was written either 麻智 or 満知.
sen.cmt: 同音異名の漢字はそのまま文中に残しました。
sen.e: It is said that his given name was also written by using other kanji 麻智 or 満知.
sen.cmt: name→given name 原訳では「満智」が表記の選択肢から外れてしまい不適当です。 Written either 麻智 or 満知→also written by using other kanji 麻智 or 満知
sen.e: It is said that his given name was also written by using other kanji 麻智 or 満知.
He had the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
He had the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).
He had the title of Sukune (third highest of the eight hereditary titles).

sen.j: 履中天皇2年、平群木菟宿禰や葛城円とともに執政官となる。
sen.e: In 401, he became an administration officer along with HEGURI no Tsuku no Sukune and KATSURAGI no Tsubura.
In 401, he became an administration officer along with HEGURI no Tsuku no Sukune and KATSURAGI no Tsubura.
In 401, he became an administration officer along with HEGURI no Tsuku no Sukune and KATSURAGI no Tsubura.

sen.j: 『古語拾遺』によれば、雄略天皇代、増大する諸国からの貢物に対応すべく、新たに大蔵が興された。
sen.e: According to "Kogo-shui" (History of the Inbe clan), Okura (a government treasury) was set up to receive gifts from other countries in the era of the Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Kogo-shui" (History of the Inbe clan), Okura (a government treasury) was set up to accommodate the increasing number of gifts presented from regions throughout the nation in the era of Emperor Yuryaku.
sen.cmt: 諸国:ここでは「国内各地」の意味と思われます。Emperorの前のtheを削除しました。 増大する：訳抜け to receive gifts→to accommodate the increasing number of gifts presented
sen.e: According to "Kogo-shui" (History of the Inbe clan), Okura (a government treasury) was set up to accommodate the increasing number of gifts presented from regions throughout the nation in the era of Emperor Yuryaku.

sen.j: 三蔵（斎蔵・内蔵・大蔵）を麻智が管理したという（三蔵検校）。
sen.e: It is said that Machi managed three treasuries called Sanzo (Imikura, Uchikura and Okura) and held the position of Sanzo Kengyo (Sanzo Administrator).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that Machi managed three treasuries called Sanzo (the three treasuries of Imikura, Uchikura and Okura) and held the position of Sanzo Kengyo (Sanzo Administrator).
sen.cmt: the three treasuries of をImikuraの前に追加しました。
sen.e: It is said that Machi managed three treasuries called Sanzo (the three treasuries of Imikura, Uchikura and Okura) and held the position of Sanzo Kengyo (Sanzo Administrator).

sen.j: この伝承は、蘇我氏が5世紀後半すでに朝廷財政を統括していた史実を伝えている可能性がある。
sen.e: This tradition might suggest that the SOGA clan was controlling financial affairs in the Imperial Court in the end of the 6th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This tradition might suggest that the SOGA clan was controlling financial affairs in the Imperial Court in the latter half of the 5th century.
sen.cmt: end of 6th→latter half of 5thとしました。
sen.e: This tradition might suggest that the SOGA clan was controlling financial affairs in the Imperial Court in the latter half of the 5th century.

sen.j: しかし、三蔵のうち斎蔵は実在しなかったと見られている。
sen.e: However, it is believed that Imikura did not exist in the Sanzo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it is believed that among the above three treasuries, Imikura did not exist.
sen.cmt: 三蔵のうち：in the Sanzoをamong the above three treasuriesとしthatの直後に置きました。
sen.e: However, it is believed that among the above three treasuries, Imikura did not exist.

sen.j: また、百済に倣ってクラが内蔵と大蔵に分割される時期は6世紀末より遡らないと考えられている。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Kura (the Treasury) was not divided into Uchikura (Inner Treasury) and Okura (Great Treasury), having copied the system in Baekje (a Kingdom of Korea), until the end of the 6th century.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, it is thought that it was not until the end of the 6th century that the Kura (the Treasury) was divided into Uchikura (Inner Treasury) and Okura (Great Treasury) on the model of the system employed in Baekje (a kingdom of Korea).
sen.cmt: it is thought thatをFurthermore,の後に追加。the Kura以下、原訳having copiedの主語がKuraとなり少し不自然な構成となっています。ほぼ全文書換えました。
sen.e: Furthermore, it is thought that it was not until the end of the 6th century that the Kura (the Treasury) was divided into Uchikura (Inner Treasury) and Okura (Great Treasury) on the model of the system employed in Baekje (a kingdom of Korea).

sen.j: なお、満智を百済の権臣木満致に同一人とし、蘇我氏蘇我氏渡来人説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that Machi was the same person as Kimachi, an influential vassal from Baekje and therefore, the SOGA clan were settlers from Baekje.
sen.cmt: 原文にて、蘇我氏が重複しています（赤文字部分）。
sen.e: There is a theory that Machi was the same person as Mokumanchi, an influential vassal from Baekje and therefore, the SOGA clan were settlers from Baekje.
sen.cmt: 木満致:「もくまんち」ではないでしょうか？Kimachi→Mokumanchi settlers → toraijin (settlers)
sen.e: There is a theory that Machi was the same person as Mokumanchi, an influential vassal from Baekje and therefore, the SOGA clan were settlers from Baekje.

sen.j: また実在を疑う説もある。
sen.e: There is also a theory that doubts his existence.
There is also a theory that doubts his existence.
